channel.title: Understanding the actiontimer
channel.description: well, i made a code.... and i'm good with everything EXCEPT the action timer.... i know nothing about this if you could please help out on this sooo.. basically want i want the code to do is if they have the right item(s) they will cast there pole or net and catch a fish then they must wait for the action timer to lower (10 seconds) then they can cast again any help? i don't want the whole code just something that will make me understand the actionTimer.

item.title: Understanding the actiontimer
item.dc:creator: @Benz Benz
item.description:
@Benz wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:10, topic:233980”][quote author=Razr` link=topic=308491.msg2466470#msg2466470 date=1222735908]

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=308491.msg2466381#msg2466381 date=1222733365]

well, i made a code… and i’m good with everything EXCEPT the action timer… i know nothing about this if you could please help out on this sooo… basically want i want the code to do is if they have the right item(s) they will cast there pole or net and catch a fish then they must wait for the action timer to lower (10 seconds) then they can cast again any help? i don’t want the whole code just something that will make me understand the actionTimer.

[/quote]I stopped reading there.

Why did you stop reading there?
[/quote]You don’t make a “code”, lol… You make a method, or a class or anything else but not a “code”. It figures someone would ask that, that just shows how much java knowledge you have.

[quote author=MicroZoft link=topic=308491.msg2466458#msg2466458 date=1222735618]

If you don’t know how to use a timer, you’re SOL.

[code]
public int actionTimer;

if(actionTimer > 0) {
actionTimer–;
}[/code]

if(dothis && actionTimer == 0) { //Do stuff here. } else { sendMessage("You need to wait another " +actionTimer * .006+" minutes to do this again."); }

Simple.

thanks, but insulting won’t get you anywhere in life.
[/quote]You do realize SOL means stuck out of luck, right?[/quote]

Sigh, typical child on these forums.
Attempting to claim superiority over someone by ridiculing their terminology is one of the weakest things you can do.

What is inside of a class or a method, can be referred to as “code”.

Quiet your bigoted mouth, Bigh.

I await your rebuttal.

Read full topic

[/quote]I stopped reading there.

Why did you stop reading there?[/quote]You don’t make a “code”, lol… You make a method, or a class or anything else but not a “code”. It figures someone would ask that, that just shows how much java knowledge you have.

[quote=“MicroZoft, post:7, topic:233980”][quote author=Adam link=topic=308491.msg2466430#msg2466430 date=1222734740]
If you don’t know how to use a timer, you’re SOL.

[code]

if(actionTimer > 0) {
actionTimer–;
}[/code]

if(dothis && actionTimer == 0) { //Do stuff here. } else { sendMessage("You need to wait another " +actionTimer * .006+" minutes to do this again."); }

Simple.
[/quote]
thanks, but insulting won’t get you anywhere in life.[/quote]You do realize SOL means stuck out of luck, right?
